name: oppressiveness
content:
oppressiveness noun [U]
(CRUELTY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of cruelly or unfairly not allowing people the freedom they should have: They had survived the oppressiveness of apartheid. They fled the country to escape brutal oppressiveness.
More examplesFewer examplesThe latest cases illustrate the sheer oppressiveness of a law which can be used to punish or even ruin an enemy.His father told him to read Solzhenitsyn to better understand Communism's oppressiveness.The playwright evoked the suffocation of individuality and the oppressiveness of dictatorship.

oppressiveness noun [U]
(FEELING)
a quality that makes people feel worried or uncomfortable: My parents came here to escape the oppressiveness of small-town life. The overall feeling of this room was of draining oppressiveness and heaviness.
More examplesFewer examplesShe plays a suburban 1950s housewife stifled by the oppressiveness of her unfulfilling marriage.We would never paint our home in such depressing colours, but for some reason we accept this oppressiveness in the office, factory or hospital.There is a brooding oppressiveness to the silence that induces a feeling of unease.

oppressiveness noun [U]
(WEATHER)
the quality in weather of being uncomfortably hot with no wind: At last a slight breeze broke the oppressiveness.
